pros: Lovely group of people to work with Great mission overall

review_title: Hellish Work Environment! Do not work here!
job_title: Patient Access Representative in Lakewood, NJ
pros: Take action about the issues first!!
cons: The work environment I encountered was hellish with relentless pressure and a lack of support from the upper management. It was clear that they prioritized bureaucratic formalities over patient care, leaving us overwhelmend and ill-equipped to provide the necessary assistance. The relentless demands and constant changes made the job mentally and emotionally draining. turning each day into a painful ordeal.

review_title: Be Cautios of Poor Pay, Lack of Perks, and CEO's Illiterate Demeanor
pros: Athough I faced difficulties with the CEO, I have nothing but praise for my co-workers. They were an incredible team, always ready to collaborate, problem-solve and uplift one another.
cons: It became more obvious that the CEO's ignorance of employee welfare issues was a major barrier to the company's development. It was clear that they had not understood how crucial ot was to draw in and keep exceptional employees through competitive pay and all-inclusive benefits. The poor pay, lack of perks, and CEO's illiterate demeanor grew more and more intolerable as the day dragged on. Finding any drive to excel in a setting that constantly treated its employees poorly became difficult.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Lakewood, NJ
pros: Working from home was the best but being cussed out in your own home isnt
cons: Management was horrible ariel was the worst

pros: Helping patients that need medical help.
cons: The CEO is narcissistic, crass, obnoxious, incompetent & hostile. She & her groupy managers treat employees horribly. They use fear, bullying & intimidation and gossip. They should all be removed from their jobs asap for being toxic.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Lakewood, NJ
pros: The material you learn while working there is great, the trainer is so helpful and some of the employees are wonderful. The schedule is during the day Monday-Friday with rotating weekends.
cons: Being cursed out by doctors and patients on a daily basis because were so short staffed, they cant keep a doctor. More than 15 doctors have left the practice in the last 2/3 months. Its just so unorganized, the CEO will say you’re getting a raise and you wont see it for 3 months. They change procedures so often but never have a refresher course.

pros: Family that you creat with your co-workers

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Toms River, NJ
pros: Different patients. Diverse environment to expand and build on current skills.

As an active long term employee at Ocean Health Initiatives (OHI) I have to say that I was confused when reading the reviews. I was wondering whether or not we were all talking about the same organization. OHI has so many opportunities and areas for growth; you have to be a go getter and strive for excellence. You cannot expect for things to be handed to you but if you work hard for it you will succeed. I have seen Housekeepers become Patient Access Representative, Security Guards become management, and Call Center Representatives become nurses the opportunities are endless here.
The CEO has evolved OHI from one office to four and counting and she will continue to fight to get our community all of the services they deserve. She is so dedicated to our patients that she would give the shirt off of her back to whoever needed it. Not only is she the CEO of OHI; I consider her my mentor and I owe my career to her. She has always believed in me and motivated me to continue my education and persevere in my career goals. 
•	Do I always agree with her decision making? No
•	Can she be difficult at times? Yes
However this doesn’t make her a horrible CEO or OHI a horrible place to work. This only makes her human; as a manager she will have to make decisions that will not everyone happy. OHI is a family away from home and I guarantee you that you will build long lasting relationships here.
cons:
Fast Paced Environment
Must be willing to work
Must Show Compassion at all times
Must be a team player
Must be responsible

Oh wait these are things that all employers are looking!

pros:
Everyone it’s nice, feels like family.
OHI it’s expanding and trying to funds gaps where they can help the population they serve.
Gym at admin office!
cons:
- Hard for career growth and be able to move up
- Company it’s expanding, but short staff, making staff overworked and underpaid 
- Lots of people quitting
- 30 minute lunch (you have to clock in and out)
- You have to use your PTO if you get sick or have to call out due to weather 
- Watch our for you ADP punches!
- Sometimes it seems that upper management don’t listen to employees

I worked here for almost year too much stress of nasty management.  I here she is gone but once I left I felt such a relief.  Not the best benefits and not enough time off.  If you get sick or you have to leave because your child sick you will be written off.

review_title: Could be better. Upper management is tough at times.
pros: Loved my medical assistant. Building clean and maintained.
cons: Hard to schedule days off at times. Upper management does not back up employees versus blaming them.

review_title: You have to be internally motivated
pros: Competitive salary, loan forgiveness if applicable, great peers
cons: High turn over, high patient volume, micro management
